data.title: Fantastic food!  How is this place not more popular?
data.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome. I'm disappointed that I've lived here five years and am just now finding this place. We got the signature bistro burger with Parmesan and garlic fries, and the grilled chicken flatbread. Both were fantastic - full of flavor. The staff were great also, food was fairly quick and waitress was super nice. We are definitely coming back! I've noticed several reviews who didn't like that they had to wait a long time - I would attribute this to their low number of staff members (seems like only 3 or s, including the cook who doubled as a waiter). If you go during peak hours, expect to wait. We went on a Wednesday evening and with only two other tables occupied, we got great service.

data.title: They don't care about their costumors
data.text:
Yeah! Been there twice within 6 months - exactly the same!! Waited over an hour for our food both times!!
Yesterday we had to ask for to go boxes because we had to leave! We waited 1,5 hour yesterday!! We didn't even get a discount and they still ask for a tip? As far as I know you don't tip the owner? And not with such poor service!
Never going back.

data.title: Great place for Lunch
data.text: excellent chef, always great food, garlic fries to die for, burgers most excellent, service always with a smile

data.title: Best Burger in WF
data.text: We've been to the new location on Indiana a few times.  Each time, the service was good.  Matter of fact, the owner was working the crowd and took our order.  We lost our favorite burger place and 2011 Bistro has taken its place.  The meat is juicy, bun flavorful, and condiments right on target. I'll make one comment on the plain, basic french fries: crispy!  We both had burgers (I had the smoky and spouse had the American) and they were great!

data.title: Good food, but worst service ever
data.text: 2011 does have an excellent chef in the kitchen, but that's all this place has going for it. Their old location wasn't any good either, but my hopes that things would change with more space were not to come true. We showed up for a birthday for my wife, and because of the size of the party we called ahead. When we got there we asked for the high chair we told them we needed when the reservation was made, and were told the ONLY ONE they had was being used. We were upset, but were trying to figure out what to do when the host brought it to us. While I was glad my son had a place to sit, I can only imagine how upset the table that had the high chair were. When we looked at the table there was absolutely no space for people to actually sit without being on top of each other. We told them we would need to add a table to at least give everyone elbow room, and they acted like it was putting them out to get another one for us and argued for at least 5-10 min before we were accommodated. It took 30 min to get our drinks, they were never refilled, and it took an hr before we ever got our food. I understand it's run by the chef's family, but several people in my family own their own business, and they all hire enough people to make their business work correctly. When we did get out food half of it was wrong, but at that point we were just glad to have food, and there's no food a normal kid would want to eat. My daughter, who actually likes normal salads, ordered a side salad but we were not told that it had feta cheese instead of regular cheese that you'd put on a side salad a kid would eat, so she ate nothing. I only went because it's what my wife wanted for her birthday dinner, but we won't be back, and neither will most if not all of the people there with us.

data.title: Wow! The fries!
data.text:
Went to the Bistro today with a friend for our monthly lunch date "adventure". We really liked the minimalist style of decorating - a few big mirrors, bar along one side, little tables, bench seating.
Our drinks came right away but, with just 2 of us, the waitress couldn't remember who wanted the sweet tea and who wanted unsweet and which one got the lemon.
Ordered flatbreads and specialty fries for both of us. Waited quite a while, but we didn't mind, as we were catching up on gossip and so on.
When the waitress finally came with the order, she didn't even know if it was ours or not. They got the fries right, and my friend's order, but the other flatbread was NOT mine. Turns out the kitchen got the order wrong. We finished most of both baskets of fries before my order finally got there. 
The fries were amazing. Could almost have made a meal out of them alone. The flatbreads, too, were very yummy!
The service, however, was decidedly lacking. Had to ask for a second setting of napkin/silverware/straw. We were only asked once if we wanted refills on drinks, and that was before the orders arrived. When the checks finally came, had to ask for a doggy bag for my leftovers, then had to wait for our waitress to finish visiting with other customers (sitting in their booth with them, laughing and talking) to go ring us up. 
The food is definitely worth the visit, but don't expect to be wow'd by the stellar wait staff.

data.title: great food
data.text:
food is amazing and so tasty and fulfilling 
the service however is lacking 
I've been here a few times and the only reason I come is because of the food 
it's a great balance of flavors and homemade favorites with a new age twist 
I'm starting to think ill just order delivery and cut out the dining in

data.title: Disappointing.
data.text: I can only rate the service but not the food. My first visit was greatly anticipated. I had a friend visit from out of town and chose the restaurant for our lunch.  There was plenty of seating, our drinks were served almost immediately and our orders were taken quickly.  That is the end of what looked like the beginning of a four star review! After placing our orders, we had tea refills and spent some pleasant time visiting and catching up.  I noted that a couple seated after us were served. I assumed it was because I ordered a flat bread.  We realized it had been at least 30 minutes since we submitted our orders. Upon calling over one of the staff, he checked and found our order was never submitted.  The response from the waitress was that she was overwhelmed and so busy she "just forgot" to submit our order. This is uncalled for in a restaurant and small as 2011 and with only half a room of diners present! As we decided at this point there was no time to wait for them to resubmit our order. Given that we left without lunch, I cannot say anything about the quality of their food.

data.title: intersting venue, above average food
data.text: Tried 2011 bistro back in the fall and there was a nice crowd. So we had to wait a bit for a table and it was a bit greasy then. However, the food was good and fairly quick. The place could do with a little remodel. But some would say it adds to the charm.  I would like to see a little more seating and a little more service help. They were struggling the day we were there

data.title: Big Disappointment
data.text: The place was mostly empty on a Saturday night.  They said they were "out of dessert".  Seriously?  Our salads were just okay.  Slow service.  It took an act of God to finally get a cup of coffee, and even then served in a styrofoam cup with packaged cream.

data.title: The new location combines a  nice refreshing atmosphere with GREAT food!
data.text: I'd heard nice things about their food but their original location on 7th street was cramped and not so aesthetically pleasing. The new location on 8th street is spacious and is aesthetically pleasing.  It will attract more patrons. The food is still fabulous! They are now serving desserts and their bar is opening soon.  The strategically located big screen TV's are an added bonus. The service is improving! I hope this place helps revitalize downtown.

data.title: Great Surprise!
data.text: From the outside you would never realize what culinary delights await inside 2011 Bistro. The chef does a great job creating an interesting menu that is still approachable. The flat breads were the highlight with local ingredients that were truly delicious. Give it a try!

data.title: Hoping for more
data.text: I really wanted to like this place, especially since it is locally owned and I kept hearing good things. I ordered a chicken and avacado flatbread/pizza to go. They told me to give them 10 to 15 minutes. I arrived 20 minutes later and I don't think they had started my order. I waited for at l0 minutes. The service wasn't very good and the flatbread was burned. Maybe it was just an off day for the restaurant, I'm not sure if I'll try them again.

data.title: Great food!!
data.text: Literally a hole in the wall, easy to drive right by. But, if you are looking for great food, burgers, sandwiches, salads and amazing fries, this is the place to go. Great personalized service, friendly staff, including the cook. We went here to eat at the"Hotter than Hell 100", so we're quite hungry, plenty of food and all 7 of us enjoyed our menu picks. Definitely try it out, you will not be sorry you did!! Enjoy!

data.title: Would be a 5 with better service.
data.text:
After being open for a few months, we finally made it to 2011.  When we entered we realized, at one time, we had visited a cajun restaurant at the same location.  Any way, if you are looking for ambiance, go somewhere else.  I won't describe the place, just don't expect fancy.  We were quickly seated with drink orders taken and quickly provided.  However, they forgot to get us menus.  Spouse went looking for them.  Spouse is not a food adventurer and stayed on the burger side of the menu.   He ordered the American burger.   I went for the back side of the menu.  Oh, my, such a selection of salads and flat breads.  I ordered the Mediterranean Flatbread.
Remember, this is not fast food.  Be prepared for a wait.  Spouse's burger arrived with onions, which he had specifically requested be held.  Otherwise, he was very complimentary of the burger.  The bun had spent some time on the flat top and had a toasty crunch.  The meat was substantial and very tasty.  It actually tasted like hamburger.  Yes, I had a bite.  My flatbread was just as tasty.  It was covered with spinach, olives, artichoke hearts, cherry tomatoes, and feta cheese.  The flatbread also had a pleasant crunch from the grill.
Why did 2011 Bistro get a three?  The service was clearly lacking.  Our waitress, once we got our food, never came back to check on us.  Never were we asked if our food was good/bad/as ordered, nothing.  Spouse had stacked the onions on the table and the waitress didn't seem to notice.  Also, when she did notice we were through with our meal, she brought the check, cleared the table, all without a word.  I can deal with "hole in the wall", but I would like to know that my business is appreciated.

data.title: A little dive with great flavors!
data.text: A local told me this place had the best hamburgers in Wichita Falls, so that's what I thought I'd order when I ducked in to try this place out. But the menu short-circuited my original burger craving when I saw that their slaw had onions (hate onions) and I stumbled upon the Meditation Flatbread for $11.99. My choice was fabulous, with thin flatbread toasted with sundried cherry tomatoes, artichoke hearts, feta cheese, braised lamb, black olives, baby spinach, and tatziki sauce. What a mouthful of sunshine! I'd go back and order this all over again. Try the place. It's only got about 8 tables but the wait staff is friendly and it's full of locals. Don't get in a rush. These items are made to order and perfection takes time.

data.title: A hole in the wall worth visiting
data.text: My family recently had dinner at 2011 Bistro. This is a typically untypical hole in the wall and worth visiting. Don't expect fancy tables and chairs.  And frankly I'm not sure why they call it a Bistro.  The menu consists mainly of flatbreads, sandwiches, and fries.  Since it was our first time there we all ordered something different and shared.  All the flatbreads were delicious and filling.  The fries were very good and different from other restaurants.  You can expect to pay around $9.00 per person.  There is one odd thing worth mentioning...They charge 50 cents for tap water.  If your looking for some good and different food for lunch take the trip downtown to 2011 Bistro...You won't be disappointed.  Just call before you go for dinner because they are not open every evening.

data.title: Tasty Lunch
data.text: We all enjoyed our lunch at 2011 Bistro.  A coat of paint would be nice to spruce the restaurant up. Cobwebs in the bathroom and a dirty catsup bottle on the table were a distraction from the good food we enjoyed. The staff was non plussed that we were there.  It would be great for a restaurant like this to succeed and some simple improvements would make a big difference.

data.title: Great find
data.text: This place was quite good. The flat bread was great. I do feel that it was a bit pricey for a flatbread but I was very full when I left and had leftovers so I would go back. I did leave smelling like the inside so I wouldn't recommend going on your lunch break.

data.title: Flatbreads yum!
data.text: This is a great lunch spot!  I have not been there for dinner, yet!  My husband our 3 year old and I all got something different.  It was all great!  The staff is really nice and accommodating!
